results.headline: Review: Noah Buschel’s ‘Glass Chin,’ an Updated Working-Class Noir
results.summary_short: This story of a New York-area loan shark, restaurateur and boxing coach is full of hyperstylized shots, philosophizing speeches and no-way-out plotting.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Glass Chin

results.headline: Review: In ‘Ted 2,’ the Foulmouthed Bear Tries to Prove He’s Human
results.summary_short: In a quest to be a husband and father, the character voiced by Seth MacFarlane aligns his struggle with that of enslaved black Americans.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Ted 2

results.headline: Review: In ‘Runoff,’ a Rural Family Hits Desperate Times
results.summary_short: Kimberly Levin’s directorial debut centers on the Freemans (Neal Huff and Joanne Kelly), struggling to raise a family and save their farm and business.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Runoff

results.headline: Review: In ‘Max,’ a Shellshocked Dog Reverts to His Heroic Self
results.summary_short: Boaz Yakin’s film, a blend of detective story and animal tale, depicts the healing of a slain marine’s military dog under the care of the man’s brother.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Max

results.headline: Review: In ‘Felt,’ Amy Everson Plays an Eccentric, Troubled Artist
results.summary_short: In this film, a woman battles herself as she tries to recover from a trauma.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Felt

results.display_title: Batkid Begins: The Wish Heard Around the World
results.headline: Review: In ‘Batkid Begins’, a Boy’s Simple Wish Whips Up Frenzied Adulation
results.summary_short: Dana Nachman documents the overwhelming response to a 5-year-old cancer patient’s wish to become Batman.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Batkid Begins: The Wish Heard Around the World

results.headline: Review: In ‘7 Minutes,’ From Jay Martin, a Bank Robbery Plan Implodes
results.summary_short: Three friends decide to commit a crime, greatly underestimating the difficulty.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of 7 Minutes

results.headline: Review: ‘Escobar: Paradise Lost’ Stars Benicio Del Toro as Drug Lord
results.summary_short: In this fictional account of the Colombian kingpin, Pablo Escobar pulls an American surfer into his circle.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Escobar: Paradise Lost

results.headline: Review: ‘A Murder in the Park’ Challenges David Protess’s Innocence Project
results.summary_short: Thirty years later, two overturned convictions around a 1982 double murder continue to draw scrutiny and legal action.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of A Murder in the Park

results.headline: Review: ‘Advantageous’ Portrays a Future Where More Things Remain the Same
results.summary_short: This science-fiction fantasy summons up a speculative new world where the greatest threat is the same that’s haunted the planet since time immemorial — people.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Advantageous

results.headline: Review: ‘What Happened, Miss Simone?’ Documents Nina Simone’s Rise as Singer and Activist
results.summary_short: This documentary, directed by Liz Garbus, chronicles the life of Nina Simone, the singer-musician whose social circle and civil rights activism grew along with her fame.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of What Happened, Miss Simone?

results.headline: Review: ‘Rubble Kings’ Recounts a Death That Led to a Gang Truce and Changed the Bronx
results.summary_short: This documentary from Shan Nicholson traces how the violence that had overwhelmed that borough would eventually give way to a hip-hop culture.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Rubble Kings

results.headline: Review: Pixar’s ‘Inside Out’ Finds the Joy in Sadness, and Vice Versa
results.summary_short: Pete Docter’s new animated film, with the voices of television comedians like Amy Poehler, Mindy Kaling and Bill Hader, brings to life an 11-year-old’s interior drama.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Inside Out

results.headline: Review: ‘Phantom Halo,’ a Crime Caper With Thomas Brodie-Sangster
results.summary_short: Rebecca Romijn and Luke Kleintank are also in the cast of this drama, which focuses on the sons of a dissolute father.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Phantom Halo

results.headline: Review: ‘Eden,’ a D.J.’s Passion for Electronic Music, by Mia Hansen-Love
results.summary_short: The film chronicles the electronic music scene in 1990s Paris, from boom to burnout.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Eden

results.headline: Review: ‘Balls Out,’ a Sports-Movie Satire Packed With ‘S.N.L.’ Talent
results.summary_short: “This isn’t about winning,” says the coach of the motley intramural football team at the center of this comedy. “It’s about winning at the last possible second.”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Balls Out

results.headline: Review: ‘The Face of an Angel’ Dabbles in Murder and Culpability
results.summary_short: The death of Meredith Kercher, a British student, in Italy preoccupied the news media and the public. This film by Michael Winterbottom is a fictional take on the event.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Face of an Angel

results.headline: Review: ‘Manglehorn’ Stars Al Pacino as an Aging Curmudgeon
results.summary_short: Directed by David Gordon Green, the film follows the evolution of a character who seems to love only his cat.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Manglehorn

results.headline: Review: In ‘The Wanted 18,’ Palestinians Hide Cows From Israeli Forces
results.summary_short: This documentary recalls the lengths that those in a town went to in 1988 to keep authorities from seizing their milk-producing cows.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Wanted 18

results.headline: Review: In ‘The Overnight,’ Newcomers Try Hard to Make Friends
results.summary_short: Bland meets bold in “The Overnight,” a comedy that coyly dips its toe and a few other body parts in the new sexual revolution.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Overnight
